message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.PL, cs.CV

The paper proposes a system for amortized inference in probabilistic programming languages (PPLs) using neural networks. This involves optimizing guide programs to approximately sample from the posterior distribution defined by the original program. This work is highly relevant to the fields of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and systems and control (cs.SY) due to its focus on probabilistic programming and neural networks. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the proposed system for image processing tasks (cs.CV), which further supports the inclusion of this sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses the implementation of the system using Pyro (cs.PL), a popular PPL framework.
